results.definition: a specific piece of work required to be done as a duty or for a specific fee
examples: estimates of the city's loss on that job ranged as high as a million dollars
the job of repairing the engine took several hours
the gang pulled off a bank job in St. Louis

results.definition: the principal activity in your life that you do to earn money
arranged for contracted work to be done by others
a state of difficulty that needs to be resolved
examples: it is always a job to contact him

results.definition: a book in the Old Testament containing Job's pleas to God about his afflictions and God's reply

examples: dry rot did the job of destroying the barn
the barber did a real job on my hair

results.definition: a Jewish hero in the Old Testament who maintained his faith in God in spite of afflictions that tested him
an object worked on; a result produced by working
examples: he held the job in his left hand and worked on it with his right

results.definition: any long-suffering person who withstands affliction without despairing
a workplace; as in the expression `on the job'
(computer science) a program application that may consist of several steps but is a single logical unit
profit privately from public office and official business
the performance of a piece of work
examples: she did an outstanding job as Ophelia
he gave it up as a bad job
it is their job to print the truth
As a student I jobbed during the semester breaks
